etymology.description: Depicts a hand 又(又) (yòu, "hand") holding a brush 𰀁(𰀁) (unknown pronunciation, "brush") -> represents a brush
etymology.interpretation: This character visually represents the act of holding a writing brush, emphasizing its use in writing and calligraphy.

examples.chinese: 他用肀蘸上墨水(他用肀蘸上墨水)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng yù zhàn shàng mòshuǐ.
examples.english: He dipped the brush in ink.

examples.chinese: 古代画家喜爱用肀调墨(古代畫家喜愛用肀調墨)，创作精美画卷(創作精美畫卷)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài huàjiā xǐ'ài yòng yù tiáo mò, chuàngzuò jīngměi huàjuǎn.
examples.english: Ancient painters loved to use the brush to adjust ink and create exquisite scrolls.

examples.chinese: 他以肀写下心灵之语(他以肀寫下心靈之語)，传递古老智慧(傳遞古老智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ yù xiě xià xīnlíng zhī yǔ, chuándì gǔlǎo zhìhuì.
examples.english: He used the brush to write expressions of the soul and convey ancient wisdom.
